dcterms:description: The Pendulum problem is a classic control problem where the goal is to balance a pendulum on a cart by applying forces to the cart. The state space includes the angle and angular velocity of the pendulum, and the action space consists of the forces applied to the cart.
dcterms:title: Pendulum problem

dcterms:creator: Timothy Lillicrap
Jonathan Hunt
Alexander Pritzel
Nicolas Heess
Tom Erez
Yuval Tassa
David Silver
Daan Wierstra
dcterms:description: The MountainCar problem is a reinforcement learning task where an underpowered car must drive up a steep hill. The goal is to build enough momentum to reach the top of the hill. The state space includes the position and velocity of the car, and the action space consists of the forces applied to the car.
dcterms:title: MountainCar
